sense.trans: expect to realize s.t. out of s.t.

eg.trans: You will get exactly nothing from that sort of livelihood.

eg.i: Unsay maandu mu ánang pagpúnay ug katúlug?
eg.trans: What do you expect to get out of sleeping all the time?

sense.trans: sum up, make an account of.

eg.i: Nag-andu siya sa mga butang nga wà gánì níya mahímu,
eg.trans: She is counting up things for credit to get credit for them, when she hasn’t even done them.

eg.i: Ayaw kug paningli, kay ug andúhun nátù ag ákung nagastu nímu, dì ka kabayad,
eg.trans: Do not try to collect what I owe you, because if we sum up all that I spent on you, you could never pay.

eg.i: Kun makaandu na ka, dì ka na makapunù,
eg.trans: When you have already laid your cards on the table, you cannot add any more cards.

sense.trans: but actually, when it came (comes) to the test (when the cards were laid on the table).

eg.i: Sígi siyang hangyù. Pag-andù pa, dì diay gustu,
eg.trans: He kept begging, but when I finally agreed to it, he didn’t want to.

eg.i: Padatùdátù siya. Pag-andù pa, pubri kaáyu,
eg.trans: He pretended to be rich. But when it came to the test, he turned out to be poor.

eg.i: Wà pay andu ug maghíkay ba mi sa pyista,
eg.trans: We’re undecided as yet whether to prepare for the fiesta.

eg.i: Mag-andúhay ta arun mahúsay ang tanan,
eg.trans: Let’s have it out to settle everything.

eg.i: Anduhúnun pa ning ákung pagpaiskuyla nímug midisína,
eg.trans: I’m not sure whether we will send you to medical school.
